I had both the white and red wine flights so got to taste many of the wines on the menu and the selections were all enjoyable.  I couldn't pass up the tempting looking pastries and ended up with the ginger blueberry muffin which was very good, not too sweet and definitely helped with soaking up the alcohol!

In addition our server was super friendly and knowledgeable of all the wines he was pouring.  I will definitely be back to try the coffee as it smelled divine!
author: KC S.

description: Had a nice ass macchiato. They use counter culture beans so it was bound to be good. Barista was warm like my macchiato.
author: Madeline S.

description: They had an arrested development quote on their sign outside, so we came in. Great pour over coffee and good music.
author: Rayna K.

description:
First of all. There is no decaf espresso. So if you want a decaf latte don't count on it. The woman who helped us either had a VERY dry sense of humor or was just plain rude but either way it wasn't the type of service anyone really enjoys while ordering their coffee. Every question I asked was met with a quick reply and no elaboration. I asked if they had Mexican hot chocolate because I had seen something on Yelp about it and the woman just said "no we don't have that." So then I asked if it was seasonal or something and she said "no that's some other store." Seriously, if you don't like dealing with talking to people and being helpful I really think this type of job isn't your calling...but hey that's just my opinion. My girlfriends and I were waiting to get picked up by my boyfriend who was stuck in traffic and we were told that they were closing really soon and the inflection in the woman's voice was basically like "..... So leave". Promptly at 8:00 we were told that we had to leave with a very rude tone even though they were clearly still cleaning up behind the counter. If it was really that necessary that we leave immediately it would have been nice to at least have been asked nicely instead of in a demeanor closer to the phrase "don't let the door hit you on the way out." 

As for the quality of the drinks, it was okay. I've definitely had much better coffee. And the chai tea latte was mediocre.
author: Beca P.

description:
Caffeinated poetry.

Brilliantly smooth blend of Ethiopian drip.

Unique and appropriate wine barrel tops for tables.

Friendly and inviting staff.

Deep and captivating red paint and accents.

WiFi to keep an eye on the rest of the world.

Comes together in true poetic fashion at Haight's newest cafe and wine bar.
author: Jason B.

description: Eh.  I didn't get a chia tea there I got a disappointment.  Also I got persuaded into buying it RIGHT then. They couldn't wait. I was literally about to piss on the floor.  They need to get their lives together.
author: Maxwell P.

description:
Finally! A real coffee shop on Haight Street!
A cozy little spot to sip on fancy coffee drinks. Now with Wifi too.
In my opinion, much better service and drinks compared to Haight's newest addition, Flywheel, on Stanyan next to Whole Foods. (Flywheel's cappuccinos are not good, I'll fly my wheels down to Stanza instead.)

Friendly and experienced crew. I will admit the prices are a bit higher than I would like, but I am always satisfied with the outcome of my drinks.

Great cappuccinos, lattes, and excellent iced coffee.
Thanks Stanza.
author: Nathan H.

description: Great customer service with amazing coffee. Even with a long line the barista created an awesome latte with beautiful art. I highly recommend the Mocha, best I've had in a long time.
author: Thomas H.

description:
Great coffee and tea, good service, working wifi and power for laptops. Though a bit short on space, it's easily the best coffee shop in the Haight.

The only things that would make this place better is if they played the music at a lower volume and kept the place warmer.
author: Steve D.

description: Hands Down The Best Coffee I've Ever Tasted. Stanza on Haight My New Favorite Coffee Bar in The City
author: David S.

description: A cozy and welcoming coffee shop that has a very nice atmosphere and has a really good cup of coffee. I was walking in the Haight and was looking for a coffee shop near by when I pass this place by. It was meant to be because I think I found my go to coffee shop when I'm in the Haight. Very Pricey which is why I had to give it one less star, but nonetheless you get what you pay for when you order from here; the quality of the coffee is exceptional. The staff was very nice too! I experienced friendliness and good customer service despite having to wait for a fresh pot of French Press coffee. All in all, I'm going to make sure to stop by again whenever i need to decompress and relax on a nice day.
author: Henry C.

description: Love their iced coffee and their Soy Chai Tea is awesome!
author: Christopher N.

description: Hands down my favorite coffeeshop in the bay. There are so many things they got just right. Great French press, killer blueberry white chocolate muffin, cool art that's not too weird, nice red interior with oak barrel table, and the best of all, the friendliest baristas in SF.
author: Charles Z.

description: Absolutely amazing coffee. Such wonderful staff. We are definitely coffee snobs and the temperature, foam to milk to caramelized brown espresso was great. The staff couldn't be nicer. Often walking into a coffee bar with two little kids (who order babycinos) elicits scowls or looks of impatience. Not here, they checked to see if the kids thought the babycinos were just right, talked respectfully to the kids and were knife and friendly with us. Love this place.
author: Eve M.

description: Excellent spot. Stopped in here and was immediately helped and served amazing Egyptian Chamomile Tea...nice staff, cool music, and fun cask top Barrell tables. Got the last spot. Restroom available, too.  Perfect. And my wife loves her latte!
author: Bjorn R.

description: I went into this place with high standards, but they were quickly shot down. It appears very ritzy and nice, but here's the first problem: there was one guy running the whole show. He made my friend's drink and ran her up quickly but then completely forgot to ask me for my drink order while taking orders and ringing up the line behind me. Really? Was there a sign on my head that said "do not serve me?" He finally asked me, "you ordered, right?" I responded that I hadn't and he took my order. The drink wasn't even that impressive for the price. It you want a snobby atmosphere and bad service, then come here. My advice: hire more baristas and pay better attention to your customers.
author: Amanda F.

description: I'll be honest...I've walked by this place without noticing many times. Today however I walked in and ordered a chai latte. Seemed a little watery but the taste was really quite good. And it's a spicy chai, delicious. Inside is very neat. Feels like a nice hotel bar. I'd go again.
author: Shane T.

description:
coffee is good.
ambiance is nice.
love the coffee counter.
but they do not have any wine. beware if you are looking for a glass.
service was nice.
they have sweets but no other food.
author: K E.

description: Regular coffee here is horrible! Had to wait 4 min for bad coffee! My boyfriend had the espresso machiato and he said it was not that great. We are avid coffee drinkers and know what good coffee is. Also, the place is a bit prententious. They display their ice coffee like a scientific contraption oozing through coffee grind, driping into a tube slowly. You are better off going to your local Starbucks.
author: Janice M.

description: Such a great place! Ethiopian Iced Drip coffee was what coffee dreams are made of. Free wifi and shelter from the freaks on Haight St. I'll be back!
author: Andrew C.

description: I stumbled past this place while recording shopping down Haight. I normally don't drink coffee but it was chilly out and I had a long walk still to get to my shops, so I stopped in "just to look around." The Barista was extremely friendly and was quick to share all about their Augie's coffees, their pastries and about the story of this new coffee/wine bar. I ended up trying the Rwanda roast, which had a hint of grapefruit and was wonderful! Definitely worth a second visit, for the Rwanda or to try one of their other offerings.
author: Kelly Q.

description: I was not that happy during my 2nd visit. The coffee was a little to sweet for my own liking, little bit disappointed that they didn't offer the mexican chico. Oh well, I guess not everything can stay good forever. But the place is still the same, very hipster mixed with contemporary vibe.
author: Cavin T.

description: By far the best damn Mocha I have EVER had.......the service is simple, the decor is is lounge-like, and the chocolate inside the Mocha is superb. As a chocolate lover, I hate it when my mocha is basically coffee, and up this point every coffee shop has just given me coffee instead of mocha. this review is long overdue but whatever..i will continue to go to stanza and I will be sure recommend stanza in the future...OMG!!
author: Daniel W.

description: Made the best chai I've ever had, very upscale vibe compared to most businesses in the area.  My gf got an espresso that was VERY strong, so strong that it possibly contributed to her later having a reaction to her antibiotics! But I won't blame the coffee :) it was great! They played great upbeat music too! Seems like it would be a regular spot for me if I lived in the area...
author: Mikey B.

description: I would say, "Finally, good coffee in my neighborhood"... But this isn't just good coffee. This is the kind of coffee that makes me feel the need to finish a black coffee (after months of drowning them in soy), along with a deftly-turned cappuccino, AND an ice coffee, and then rearrange my evening plans to go along with the imminent pre-psychotic state that much caffeine can induce (Dr. Jena and Ms. Party). The décor is simple and weirdly elegant for the Haight, they weren't playing their friend's crustpunk band on the stereo, and the manager was charmingly passionate about serving artisanal coffee. This place will be constantly packed sooner or later, so I might as well give you all a tip before you get in line: try the ice coffee... It's ambrosia. Now, where's the party at.
author: Jena H.

description: Wish they had wine still, but JUST had the best mocha ever. Not to sweet, perfect creamy cocoa flavor. I hope they become my new mocha spot. I'll see how my next mocha turns out.
author: Lisa S.

description: I actually totally forgot what this was, so that's not a good sign.  That being said, this is some serious coffee.  I got a delicious mocha here.  The atmosphere is pretty nice, but the stoned dirty hippies kind of throw that off.  But isn't that all of Haight/Ashbury?
author: Joanna F.

description: Way over hyped. Cute little coffee shop with horrible coffee. The chocolate & pastry selection is very limited. It gets really crowded really fast since its so small. the service sucks.
author: Kyle S.

description:
Popped in, excited that the neighborhood has another business that's got some soul poured into it, and isn't built to be just good enough for tourists to reject after the first try.  We've got enough of those in the Haight, and clearly, we've got some new blood coming in. 

It's pretty, and so are the staff.  I 

Me? I'm finicky, and drink decaf.  Since they don't serve it here, I'll stick to Haight Street Market, which does.  I'm bummed, since I'm craving a new spot where I can sit and read my book on my lunch hour.  

C'mon, pretty new neighborhood biz, please just have a jar of decaf beans for your customer's hand - poured pleasure.  It's not such a burden, and I'll gladly patronize you regularly.
author: Becka R.

description: Flavorful Kyoto-style iced coffee, perfectly spiced chai, knowledgeable barristas, delectable pastries, and eco-friendly straws.  What's not to love?
author: Chris T.

description: Great little place to chill and enjoy some pretty darn good coffee.
author: Chung Y.

description: Worldly coffee. People watch location. Stylish atmosphere. Hip. Have some time to spare. Clean. You should go here...
author: Lucy M.

description: I really like the coffee here. They craft the coffee nicely, and the presentation is beautiful (love the espresso spoons!)
author: Anastasia T.

description:
Having just moved from a coffee haven, in Portland, OR, Stanza Coffee brought a smile to my face.  Such a great atmosphere, fabulous coffee and knowledgable, friendly people!  It might just become my home away from home.   

Unfortunately, it is not a great place to sit and work.  The wine barrel tables are cute but SO uncomfortable that they are unusable.   This is the only negative in an otherwise amazing experience.
author: Kelly D.

description: Black and white hot chocolate. Get it. It's rich and a spin from your usual boxed hot cocoa.
author: Stine H.

description: The expresso drinks are very good.  Maybe not quite blue bottle, but some may like it better.  The drip coffee by contrast is not all that great.  The pastries are not intended to be their focus, but were clearly not fresh.
author: v n.

description: Came in on a Thursday morning. I like the feel of the place...kind of like a lounge and really clean. The barista was friendly and provided good service. My only complaint is that it's a bit pricey(But then again, you pay for the nice venue) and they had no brown sugar. It's a nice place to have a latte,coffee, etc.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Haight needs a few more options, true. Stanza is a good ol' college try. Wine barrel tables and chairs help .
 But in a city of fine coffee, chocolate and wine, this place is just meeting "ok" level compared to the price point and sparse menu. It's not a cafe or wine bar I'm dying to hang out in with a book twice a week and saturdays.  But I stop by on occasion when I want to have a glass of good wine and catch up with a friend because there simply isn't any other place to go in upper haight/cole valley other than Magnolia and Kezar.
author: eDub W.

description: Nice ambience and nice lattes, I love stopping by when I'm in the area. It's near haight-ashbury, one of my favourite parts of San Francisco. The coffee is delicious and selection of teas and pastries is also good. Staff is friendly and always up to recommend drinks. I went and it wasn't that busy, but I can imagine it would get crowded quickly.
author: Christine S.

description: Great French pressed cup of coffee while I charged my phone. A bar with plugs all along it is awesome and much appreciated.
author: Gretchen H.

description: The best coffee in town. Love the place, has a great feel.
author: Ahmad D.

description: If you've got time on your hands it's a cool place. But waiting 20 minutes for two cups of coffee was a little disappointing...
author: Michelle L.

description: My new favorite place for coffee (better than Blue Bottle) or a glass of wine. Gorgeous interior, cool music and overall vibe. Plus - the staff is friendly (are you listening LaBoulange?) and knowledgable about what they're serving. Dog friendly, too. Run don't walk.
author: Katy M.

description: Nicely kept cafe. I got an iced coffee and it had the most fruity flavor I've ever tasted. Interesting! I was a little disappointed to see that the iced coffee was already made. I was expecting a fresh cup made right in front of me. Oh well, no biggie. I'd come back here if only if I was already in the area.
author: T L.

description: So I walk in, and immediately just love the vibe of this place. Design, furniture, music - everything is just on point! I ordered a regular hot cocoa with some whipped cream on top and let me just say that was THE best cup of cocoa I've had in a long time! The barista was extremely friendly and took the time to answer all of my questions in detail which i appreciated very much. I absolutely loved Stanza, the baristas, and their amazing cocoa. I will most definitely be coming back very soon to try all of their coffees and sweets!
author: Abey A.

description:
exclusively single origin coffees, locally sourced wine, wifi, clean,  delicious pastries from Mission Beach Cafe and Anthonys Cookies, incredible iced coffee and great music selection. 

This is definitely the latest and greatest addition to Haight st. open at 6:30 in the morning and stays open until 10pm. A specially created wine just for this space called Love | Haight offering 3 delicious varietals: Sauvignon Blanc, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. 

Definitely a must visit place while on Haight, a wonderful escape from the smoke shops, "vintage" stores, and the heckling from street kids. Enjoy coffee and wine nirvana.
author: Krystal E.

description: Taylor the barista: She is excellent! She makes great cappuccinos and best of all, is very good to customers. I was having a battery charger woe and she helped me charge my iphone while I stayed at the coffee shop.
author: Nica M.

description: Low-key, friendly, good basic selection.  Nice and clean.  Keep it up.
author: Gleason M.

description: The espresso here is excellent, perhaps the best in town. Thick, creamy, full of flavour (cherry tart as another review mentioned) and not a hint of ash/charcoal - delicious!
author: Ricardo A.

description: No doubt the best coffee and wine on Haight. Incredibly knowledgeable baristas too. I'm already a regular.
author: Christina V.

description: Great coffee of equivalent quality to (fill in the blank....Blue Bottle, etc). - best pure cafe anywhere nearby.    Subtle and elegant decor. Beautiful lighting and finishes....this could be a date place, if not for the obvious location.You must see the cold brew setup, with laboratory-style glass flasks.     Only flaw is the barrel tabletops.   Cappuccino, espresso and drip all excellent.
author: Barry C.
